definition: to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: There exist a fact that most of us will undoubtedly be greedy at the sight of money.
sentences.chinese: 有一个事实我们不能否定就是大多数人都是见钱眼开。

sentences.english: Yulan's father, Zhu Daji, agrees to sell his ancestral house to the government.
sentences.chinese: 玉兰的父亲朱大吉见钱眼开，竟将祖屋授权给政府。

sentences.english: There is no need to waste energy to contact a person seeks.
sentences.chinese: 也没有必要浪费精力去交往一个见钱眼开的人。

sentences.english: You are too easily influenced by money.
Mummy and Daddy do not actually want Justin to become a child who sees only money.
sentences.chinese: 爸比妈咪并不希望大贝贝变成见钱眼开的小孩。

definition: to be greedy in getting money
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
mad about money (idiom)
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
variant of 唯利是圖|唯利是图[wei2 li4 shi4 tu2]
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
unscrupulous businessperson/profiteer/philistine
to be self-interested
blinded by greed (idiom)
unscrupulous businessman/profiteer/shark/dishonest business
snobbish
vain
snob
short-sighted
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
